messages.content: 9-1-1, what's your emergency?
Hi. My name is Jean Thomas. I'm watching my home on live monitor and there's a black man in my house and he's robbing it.
Where are you calling from?
I'm calling from my office and I have a live video monitor and I just...
What city are you calling from, ma'am?
I'm in Fort Lauderdale at my work.
So you don't know him?
No, I don't. And he's in my house. I'm seeing him walking around my house. He's in my bedroom right now.
Okay, hold on a second.
Please. We've already been robbed of everything.
Pardon me?
Hold on just a second.
What is he wearing, ma'am?
It's just blacked out on me. I can't tell. It's too dark. I can tell it's a black man. That's all I can tell.
The screen just blacked out?
Yeah, hold on just a second.
Yeah, she's watching it from work on one of those live video cameras and he's in her home, in her bedroom, and they've been robbed before.
How long has he been in there, ma'am?
I don't know. I just called 911 as soon as I saw it.
Did the screen come back on?
No, it hasn't yet. It's still trying to connect.
Okay, hold on a second. Please get somebody there quick.
Ma'am, they're on the way. We just need as much information as possible.

Oh, there he is! He's in a long-sleeve shirt. Can you tell what color, or is it black and white? I can't tell. It's too dark still. He just walked back into my bedroom again. He's just walking around my house.
Okay, so it's definitely a black male, long-sleeved shirt?
Yes, a shirt over a shirt. And he's in my home.
Can you tell if he has any weapons?
I can't tell.
Okay. Is he still in the bedroom at this time?
Yes. I'm watching it right now. I can't believe this.
Alright, ma'am. What's your name?
My name is Jean. My last name is Thomas.
And your phone number?
My cell phone is [number].
Is anyone else at your house?
No, nobody's there. My little boy is at school, I'm at work.
Does anyone else have a key?
No. There goes my cat. She's running. I've got three dogs in there.
Okay, ma'am, from your front door, where is your bedroom located?
Straight through to the right. It's on the northwest side.
Okay, hold on. Does he have a mask or anything on?
No, I don't see a mask or anything.
Does he have any type of tools that he might have used to break in?
He could have come through my doggy door.
Okay, he's coming out. He has a white shirt.
Hold on a second. Do you think he's exiting the house now?
No, he's walking next to my stereo. He's looking at my son's video games. He's rummaging through the house. I'm going to lose the connection in about 34 seconds.
Are the officers there yet?
No, but please hurry. He's now in my living room.
Ma'am, I just need as much information as possible. What is he doing now?
He's picked up a Wii video game. He has something in his hands. He's now in the living room.
Okay, so he's in the living room. Can you see what he's picked up?
It just blacked out on me. I'm trying to get back in.
Does it usually do that?
Yes, it only connects for about three minutes at a time.
It's connecting back again. Please hurry!
Ma'am, we do have an officer on the scene.
As soon as the screen comes back, I need to know where he is.
Okay, it's coming back. Hurry! Oh God, please hurry.
They've stolen everything. All my jewelry, all my coins.
Do you have an alarm system, ma'am?
Yes, but it's not connected.
Has the screen come back on yet?
It's still connecting, but it's taking too long.
It's probably the same person who broke in before.
Okay, the screen is back. I don't see anyone right now.
Alright, please keep watching and let me know if you see anything.
Oh, he's coming out of the bedroom again. He's in the living room.
Alright, where is he now?
He's looking around. He's got something in his hands. He's back in the living room.
Hold on just a second.
Oh, God. I can't believe this.
He's running out the back door!
There are two people in the house now!
Hold on, there's another person in the house?
Yes, another person in a big jacket just came in through the back.
Okay, can you see both of them?
They're running around, looking out the back window.
Are they still in the house?
Yes, I can see them both. One is heavy with a big hood on. They're looking out the back window.
Okay, just keep watching them. Officers are on the way.
Oh, one is running to the front; the other is trying to figure out which way to go!
Ma'am, stay calm. Officers are surrounding your house.
Alright. My cat is scared, and my dogs are hiding.
It's going to be okay. Just keep watching and tell me what you see.
They're running around trying to get out!
Ma'am, are there any weapons in your house?
No, I don't keep any weapons.
Do you see anyone else on the camera?
I'm trying to reconnect the camera.
Ma'am, the officers have apprehended two people.
I need to know if you see anyone else once the screen comes back.
Thank God. I hope they got them. There are so many people next door, I can't tell who's who.
Okay, I see someone in my house!
Can you tell if it's a police officer?
I don't know. I just see someone in my house.
Okay, hold on. Officers should be inside now.
I see my dog running; she's scared.
I see another officer now.
How many subjects did you see in total?
Just the two. One with a white shirt, and one with a big jacket.
Okay, so you've seen two subjects, mostly the one in the white shirt?
Yes, the other one came later.
Alright, ma'am. Can you head to your house now?
Yes. It'll take me about 30 minutes; I'm in Fort Lauderdale.
What type of vehicle will you be in?
A blue Honda CRV.
Ma'am, just a note, an officer had to push part of the fence in to get inside.
I don't care about the fence. Thank you for your help.
You're welcome.
